alert.note: Alert for South Central Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 19 at 3:08AM PDT until March 19 at 2:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Wet snow. Storm total 4 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...South Central Siskiyou County above 5000 feet, including the road to the Shasta Ski Park and Bunny Flat. * WHEN...From 2 AM to 2 PM PDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult due to slick roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The best chance for accumulating snow will be in the morning, then snow is generally not expected to stick to roads, except in heavier snow. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
